item.title: Nintendo Shutting Down Switch eShop And Other Services In China In 2026
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nintendo-shutting-down-switch-eshop-and-other-services-in-china-in-2026/

Nintendo is shutting down the Switch eShop and all other online services in China in 2026.

In an announcement on Tuesday, Tencent, which manages Nintendo’s sales in the country, confirmed that as of March 31, 2026 the Nintendo Switch eShop will stop selling games and software within the country. Weeks later on May 15, 2026, Switch owners will no longer be able to download games, DLC, or redeem any codes for the system.

All other online services will also shut down on May 15.

For those who currently own a Nintendo Switch and have an active WeChat account, the company is giving away up to four free Nintendo Switch games from November 27, 2024 through March 31, 2026. The list of games players can choose from include:

  • New Super Mario Bros U Deluxe
  • Super Mario Odyssey
  • Mario Kart 8 Deluxe
  • Super Mario Party
  • Mario Tennis Aces
  • Yoshi’s Crafted World
  • Flexible Brain School
  • Dr Kawashima’s Brain Exercises
  • Kirby Star Allies
  • New Pokémon Snap
  • Pokémon Go! Pikachu
  • Pokémon Let’s Go! Eevee

What do you think of all of Nintendo’s online services shutting down for the Switch in China in a year and a half? Join the discussion below and in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Is Marvel Rivals Free to Play? Cost Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-marvel-rivals-free-to-play-cost-explained/

Marvel Rivals’ ambition is matched by its star-studded roster, list of iconic maps, and excitable community eager to play. However, one big question circling Marvel Rivals is if the shooter is free to play, or if you need to pay a fixed price to get your heroic groove on.

Fans of the MCU—and Marvel in general—can rest easy as the Marvel Rivals release date is nearly upon us. An ensemble shooter with a list of playable characters so almighty it’s enough to make your eyes water—I’m not crying, you are. Marvel Rivals takes the hero shooter literally by supplying a roster chock-full of some of the most notable superheroes and villains in media.

Several successful alpha and beta tests have set the scene, the roadmap ahead is promising, and it’s nearly time to say “Action!” and let the chaos unfold. No doubt you want to play Marvel Rivals, so let’s see if greatness requires a gratuity.

How Much is Marvel Rivals?

Marvel Rivals is a free-to-play, third-person shooter, meaning, you don’t have to pay a penny to play NetEase Games’ shooter—a free download and a stable internet connection are the only requirements.

The live-service model continues to be a trendsetter for many shooters and fellow online multiplayer platforms. It’s no surprise to see Marvel Rivals adopt the F2P formula with contemporaries such as Concord and Suicide Squad showing how a paid, live-service title can fail.

So, if you want to enjoy all Marvel Rivals has to offer without spending a single penny, you go right ahead. Of course, Rivals has an abundance of microtransactions and Season Passes filled with content for players who want to more out of the shooter, but it’s entirely optional.

Thankfully, every current character is available at launch, and according to the official site, “All heroes will be unlocked and free-to-play at launch and beyond, ensuring every player can fully immerse themselves in the experience of becoming their favorite Super Hero without any barriers!”

How to Play Marvel Rivals for Free

Once Marvel Rivals releases, it’s likely all you have to do is go to your platform’s storefront, search for the game, and press to download it.

It’s sure to be as simple as this. Like Fortnite, Warzone, Overwatch 2, or any other free-to-play title, Marvel Rivals is a quick and easy download. Here are the steps you probably need to follow to download the Marvel shooter:

  1. Load up your PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, or PC.
  2. Go to the PlayStation Store, Microsoft Store, or Steam.
  3. Search for Marvel Rivals.
  4. Once it’s live, press the download option.
  5. Make sure you have room for the file size.
  6. When it’s installed, press on Marvel Rivals to play for free!

Are you excited about Marvel Rivals? Will you buy cosmetics for your favorite characters? Get involved and let us know. Also, if you didn’t already know, find out the shooter’s status on Xbox and PlayStation.

item.title: Sony and Kadokawa Have Talked Purchase In The Past
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/sony-and-kadokawa-have-talked-purchase-in-the-past/

According to a new report, Sony and Kadokawa have been discussing a partnership for years. 

Since Sony sent a letter of intent to Kadokawa, the entire gaming community has been wondering whether this acquisition will go through, and now new information has come to light. According to a Bloomberg report, Sony and Kadokawa have been “testing the waters for a potential combination for years.” However, the issue seems to be the “degree of commitment.” 

As the report states, Kadokawa wants Sony to acquire them completely or not purchase anything at all. On the other hand, Sony only wants ownership of assets related to anime and video games, which will help build their IP portfolio. The Kadokawa group has several game developers under its banner, including heavy hitters like FromSoftware, Spike Chunsoft, Gotcha Gotcha Games, and more. 

In other news, Sony is developing a PlayStation Handheld that will rival the likes of Switch and Xbox. Also, the PlayStation 5 Pro sold better than the PlayStation 4 Pro in the same period. item.title: Black Ops 6 CODMAS event release date & everything we know
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-codmas-event/

CODMAS returns in 2024 with Black Ops 6 and Warzone, bringing all kinds of holiday gifts and surprises for players. Driving the holiday spirit, Treyarch have detailed what to expect in the CODMAS event, from the return of the Nuketown Holiday map to limited-time modes.

Here’s everything you need to know about the Warzone and Black Ops 6 CODMAS event, including its release date and expected content.

When is CODMAS event in Black Ops 6 & Warzone?

The devs have not confirmed an official date for the Black Ops 6 CODMAS event yet, but if we look at last year’s release date for the event, we expect it to arrive mid-December, perhaps Tuesday the 17th.

The event is definitely arriving, as the Black Ops 6 Season 1 blog confirmed its return alongside Nuketown Holiday, the Christmas-themed variant of the iconic map that’s set to arrive in the days leading up to CODMAS.

The previous year’s CODMAS event landed on December 19 and ended on January 3, so if that’s anything to go off, this year’s event will also last around 2 weeks as well. Keep in mind that this is just speculation, so take it with a pinch of salt. Treyarch will likely announce the event soon, so when they do, we’ll be sure to refresh this piece with the details.

Expected content for CODMAS in BO6 & Warzone

  • Event rewards
  • Limited-time modes
  • Themed maps
  • Store bundles
  • Warzone mode

Similarly to last year’s CODMAS event, BO6 players can expect to see an in-game event panel with a variety of rewards for players to earn. These prizes will likely be cosmetic rewards like Charms, Calling Cards, Emblems, Weapon Blueprints, and maybe even an Operator skin. We also expect to see Holiday-themed Store bundles.

On top of tasty rewards, CODMAS will also bring themed maps and limited-time modes like last year’s Santa’s Slayground It’s unclear whether the mode will be completely new or just another iteration of last year’s.

Further, Warzone will likely also receive its own Christmas-themed mode, but players will hope that doesn’t mean the return of Krampus, who completely ruined the festivities a few years back by being an unstoppable killing force in lobbies.

Will you be celebrating the Holiday season by participating in Black Ops 6’s CODMAS event? Leave a comment in the forum to let us know!

item.title: Who is The Replacer in Black Ops 6?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/who-is-the-replacer-in-black-ops-6/

The bulk of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6’s marketing features The Replacer. The bearded character appears in various BLOPS 6 trailers and spoofs, but his origins are confusing to many—so let’s tell you everything you need to know about The Replacer.

Treyarch brought back the iconic character for Black Ops 6—marking the first time The Replacer has been seen since Black Ops 4. The character has been used in various pre-release trailers, depicted as a replacement for real people in everyday life.

The Replacer’s face has become synonymous with CoD, and I’m here to dive into who he is, the actor behind the role, and more.

Who is The Replacer Character in Black Ops 6?

The Replacer is a fictional character created specifically for the Call of Duty universe and was first seen in Black Ops 2.

With CoD’s reputation continuing to grow and its popularity soaring at an unfathomable rate, The Replacer debuted in a marketing trailer to hype up new BLOPS 2 content. In the video, The Replacer steps into the shoes of normal people going about their day to “replace” them, allowing the person to enjoy Black Ops 2 instead.

The hot reception for The Replacer resulted in the persona returning for Black Ops 3, and Black Ops 4, and they have returned for 2024’s Black Ops 6. Again, following the same ideology; players desperate to play Black Ops 6 can call upon his services to step in and fulfill their day-to-day duties.

If only The Replacer was real, he could be here writing this while I kick back and camp Hardpoints!

How to Unlock The Replacer in Black Ops 6

You unlock The Replacer in Black Ops 6 by purchasing the Tracer Pack: The Replacer Bundle from the BLOPS 6 Store.

The bundle costs 2,400 CoD Points and includes:

  • The Replacer Operator Skin
  • Blueprints
  • Finishing Move
  • Charm
  • Calling Card
  • Sticker

Who is Peter Stormare in Black Ops 6?

Peter Stormare is a Swedish-born actor playing the role of The Replacer in the Call of Duty: Black Ops series.

The actor’s legendary portfolio of acting credits—thanks to IMDB—stretches across TV, movies, and video games. Focusing on the latter, as well as The Replacer in Call of Duty, Peter Stormare has had voice roles in The Elder Scrolls: Online as King Joruun, Destiny 2 as Arach Jalaal, and Until Dawn as Dr. Hill.
